title: Analysis of the Crack Generated in Ductile Materials (Al6063), Subjected to Accelerated Aging Conditions in Elements of the Aerospace Industry
content: The accelerated aging processes in salt spray chambers show changes in the mechanical properties of the materials due to degradation by oxidation, these attacks can be compared to the attacks suffered by aircraft components particularly in the fuselage, for the evaluation of these changes stress and bending tests were applied, in specimens subjected to accelerated aging, i.e. continuous 12-hour attack cycles comprising the application of salt spray, UV radiation and controlled temperature of 40Â°C. The results of the bending give us the guideline to analyze the axial loads, eccentric loads and the transverse loads that submit elements such as axles, supports and crossbars used in the automotive and aeronautical industries. Obtaining a result of practically isotropy, that is to say that the application of accelerated aging did not modify this property, the Maximum Stress was found at 564.831 MPa and for the yielding stress at 267.5 MPas [1].
